interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Jacques Cousteau's Voyage to the Edge of the World
Review Date: 2019/10/19
Store: Jacques-Yves Cousteau  (Actor),     Phillippe Cousteau  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Documentary
Product Description: ['On his ship, Calypso, as well as in a submarine, Jacques Cousteau and his crew sail from South America and travel to Antarctica. They explore islands, reefs, icebergs, fossils, active volcanic craters, and creatures of the ocean never before seen. This voyage took place in 1975, and Captain Cousteau became one of the first explorers ever to dive beneath the waters of the frozen South Pole. This DVD includes the original theatrical movie trailer as well. A true classic.']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5822642', 'Director': 'Phillippe Cousteau', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 32 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 11, 2009', 'Actors': 'Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Phillippe Cousteau', 'Studio': 'Synergy Ent', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: JACQUES COUSTEAU'S  Adventures were always great to watch & still are........

Rating: 5.0

I will keep getting my old time DVD 's from amazon with the ease of purchase. great movie Derailed (Unrated Widescreen) Jennifer Aniston (Actor), Vincent Cassel (Actor), Mikael Hafstrom (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama ["Advertising executive Charles Schine is just another Chicago commuter who regularly catches the 8:43 A.M. train to work. But the one day he misses his train and meets Lucinda Harris, his life is changed forever. Lucinda is charming, beautiful and seductive. Despite the fact that each are married with children, their attraction to one another is magnetic. Lunch dates quickly become cocktails after work, and before long, Charles and Lucinda's infatuation leads them to a hotel room. Their seemingly perfect affair goes terribly awry when LaRoche, a brutal stranger, breaks into their room and holds them at gunpoint. This once illicit liaison turns into a nightmare more dangerous and violent than either could have ever imagined. Charles' life soon becomes filled with deception, blackmail, violence and crime. Unable to confide in his wife or speak to the police, Charles finds himself trapped in a world he doesn't recognize, with no trace of the life he once knew."] {'Genre': 'Thriller', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Jennifer Aniston, Mikael Hafstrom, Tom Conti, Melissa George, Clive Owen, Lorenzo Bonaventura, RZA, Vincent Cassel, Di Bonaventura Pictures; Miramax Films; Patalex V Productions LimitedJennifer Aniston, Mikael Hafstrom, Tom Conti, Melissa George, Clive Owen, Lorenzo Bonaventura, RZA, Vincent Cassel, Di Bonaventura Pictures; Miramax Films; Patalex V Productions Limited See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0), French (Dolby Digital 2.0), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '78649', 'Director': 'Mikael Hafstrom', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 21, 2006', 'Actors': 'Jennifer Aniston, Vincent Cassel, Tom Conti, Melissa George, Clive Owen', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Lorenzo Bonaventura', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} LOVED THIS DERAILED MOVIE GREAT ACTORS Five Stars The Professional Jean Reno (Actor), Gary Oldman (Actor), Luc Besson (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles ['Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman and Danny Aiello star in', 'Leon the Professional', ', a go-for-broke thriller about a professional assassin whose work becomes dangerously personal. Calling himself a "cleaner," the mysterious Léon is New York\'s top hit man. When his next-door neighbors are murdered, Léon becomes the unwilling guardian of the family\'s sole survivor - 12-year-old Mathilda. But Mathilda doesn\'t just want protection; she wants revenge. Training her in the deadly tricks of his trade, Léon helps her track the psychotic agent who murdered her family. From the electrifying opening to the fatal finale,', 'Leon the Professional', ', is a nonstop crescendo of action, suspense and surprises. Experience the uncut version, with 24 minutes of footage not included in the original U.S. theatrical version.'] {'Genre': 'Action, Drama, Thriller, Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Danny Aiello, Jean Reno, Natalie Portman, Les Films du Dauphin, Luc Besson', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 50 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 0.56 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'ISBN 0072317949', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Full Screen, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 24, 1998', 'Actors': 'Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman, Danny Aiello', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Luc Besson', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} GREAT MOVIE....... GREAT MOVIE Scandal At Scourie (1953) Greer Garson (Actor), Walter Pidgeon (Actor), Jean Negulesco (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles ["Legendary Hollywood screen pair Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon team for the ninth and last time in Scandal at Scourie, a heart-tugging Technicolor drama that has the duo facing obstacles with the kind of unbreakable love that saw them through aerial bombardments in Mrs. Miniver or the challenges of the medical unknown in Madame Curie. Set in Ontario, Canada, the story centers on Victoria and Patrick McChesney, whose decision to adopt an orphaned Catholic girl ignites controversy in their Protestant community. Patrick is accused of using the adoption to appeal to Catholic voeters and advance his political career. Victoria contends with self-righteous whispers about the child's out-of-wedlock birth. And an event in the child's past leads to a fear-mongering change that she is a pyromaniac. Passions and accusations rage. But like a ship plying stormy seas, the McChesney' love for each other and their child will prevail."] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Linda Greer, Jean Negulesco, Agnes Moorehead, Walter Pidgeon, Archer MacDonald, Al Ferguson, Maudie Prickett, Eugene Bordon, Donna Corcoran, Patricia Tiernan, Nolan Leary, Margalo Gillmore, John Lupton, Robert Ross, Warren Farlow, George Davis, Max Willenz, Peter Roman, Philip Ober, Wayne Farlow, Matt Moore, Jack Bonigul, Tony Taylor, Gary Lee Jackson, Wilton Graff, Roger Moore, Howard Negley, Joann Arnold, Greer Garson, Ivan Triesault, Jill Martin, Owen McGiveney, Claude Guy, Michael Pate, Rudy Lee, Earl Lee, Alex Frazer, Philip Tonge, Ivis Goulding, Coral Hammond, Ida Moore, Rhys Williams, Perdita Chandler, Charles Watts, Vicki Joy Ereutzer, Kathleen Hartnagel, John Sherman, Ian Wolfe, Walter Baldwin, Arthur Shields, Victor Wood, Edwin H. Wells' classic novel, a scientist in 1880s Victorian England builds a vehicle to transport him through time. He first travels to 1917 and the horror of World War I. Next, he sets his destination for 1940 and the start of World War II. From there he travels to a future London when he barely escapes nuclear holocaust. Sherlock Holmes (Prelude to Murder (Dressed to Kill) / Secret Weapon / Terror by Night / Woman in Green) Basil Rathbone (Actor), Nigel Bruce (Actor), Roy William Neill (Director), Howard Benedict (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama ['In', 'Prelude to Murder', "the legendary Sherlock Holmes must apply his keen ear for music to help solve this thrilling case. A trio of music boxes contains the hidden secret to vast riches, and a group of criminals is willing to kill for them. When the first of these victims is a friend of Dr. Watson, Holmes is on the case. This is the last of Basil Rathbone's portrayals of the iconic Sherlock Holmes, and certainly one of the best. This amazing colorization, created with a new cutting-edge digital technology, breathes new life into this already excellent film. Also included on this DVD is the original black-and-white version, beautifully restored as well. This is the definitive DVD edition of Prelude to Murder.

The legendary Sherlock Holmes squares off once again against his nemesis, the diabolically brilliant Professor Moriarty. Moriarty kidnaps the inventor of a new wartime bombsight, and threatens to sell the invention to the Nazis. England's fate hangs in the balance as Holmes and Watson must break a secret code of dancing men to stop the Nazis and rescue the inventor. The amazing colorization, created with a new cutting-edge digital technology, breathes new life into this already excellent film. Also included on this DVD is the original black-and-white version, beautifully restored as well. This is the definitive DVD edition of Sherlock Holmes and the", 'Secret Weapon.', '

In Terror by Night, the legendary Sherlock Holmes plunges into a thrill ride of a murder mystery set on a speeding passenger train. Holmes has been entrusted to guard the transport of the 400-carat diamond Star of Rhodesia, but when the gem is stolen, the murders start to mount. Only the masterful Holmes can deduce which of the eccentric and suspicious passengers is the true criminal. The amazing colorization, created with a new cutting-edge digital technology, breathes new life into this already excellent film. Also included on this DVD is the original black-and-white version, beautifully restored as well. This is the definitive DVD edition of', 'Terror by Night', 'for Sherlock Holmes fans.

The legendary Sherlock Holmes squares off once again against his nemesis, the diabolically brilliant Professor Moriarty. Four women are brutally murdered, and Scotland Yard thinks it is the random work of a madman. But Holmes and Watson follow a mysterious and beautiful woman into the nefarious world of blackmail and hypnotism. They deduce that something far more sinister is happening here the work of a criminal genius. The amazing colorization, created with a new cutting-edge digital technology, breathes new life into this already excellent film Also included on this DVD is the original black-and-white version, beautifully restored as well. This is the definitive DVD edition of', 'The Woman in Green.'] {'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'LGNF511DVD', 'Director': 'Roy William Neill, Howard Benedict', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 2, 2010', 'Actors': 'Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Studio': 'Legend Films', 'Number of discs': '1'} WEEKEND MOVIE WATCHING. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Movie Genre Preference:** The user continues to appreciate classic films and shows an expanding interest in documentaries, particularly those that explore exploration and adventure. Their ongoing engagement with narratives that incorporate elements of drama and mystery showcases their pursuit of complex storytelling.

- **Format Preference:** The user remains devoted to the DVD format, valuing its nostalgic connection and practical conveniences, which enhances their overall viewing experience.

- **Positive Rating Tendencies:** They maintain a pattern of highly rating films, recently giving a 5-star review to a documentary highlighting extraordinary explorations. This underscores their keen eye for quality narratives across different genres.

- **Content Engagement:** The user engages with a variety of cinematic styles, blending classic storytelling with well-crafted documentaries. Their interests reflect an enriched cinematic landscape that values both emotional depth and intellectual stimulation.

- **Actors and Directors:** Their appreciation for iconic figures in film extends to renowned documentarians, suggesting a strong preference for skilled talent that lends authenticity to their viewing choices.

- **Ease of Purchase:** The user prioritizes efficient purchasing experiences, continuously seeking quality selections to enrich their growing film collection.

Overall, the user is committed to exploring engaging narratives across both classic cinema and enlightening documentaries, maintaining a focus on the DVD format and an appreciation for nuanced storytelling.
